title: BUTT OUT
text: South Park Elementary, gymnasium, day. A school meeting is called and kids file in. Between two basketball backboards hangs a blue banner with the words "BUTT OUT!" The O doubles as a no-smoking symbol. There's plenty of chatter in the gym.

title: BUTT OUT
text: M'kay, kids, can I have it quiet, please? M'kay? M'kay, quiet now, the assembly's about to start, m'kay. M'kay, quiet ple-m k-m'kay?  M'kay. Uh, now kids, we have a really fun motivational group today who are gonna talk to you about the dangers of smoking, hm'kay? So please give a very big South Park Cows welcome to, "Butt Out!"

title: BUTT OUT
text: Butt out! Yeah yeah! Kids, that cigarette butt is gross!

title: BUTT OUT
role: Butt out! Uh huh! Smokin's got to go! [the music stops and the
text: troupe members strike poses]

title: BUTT OUT
text: Oh no...

title: BUTT OUT
text: Yeah! All right! Woohoo!!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Hey students, how are we all feelin' today? Woooo!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Hey, did you guys know that each year over six hundred thousand people a year die from smoking? A year!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Six hundred thousand?? Are you sure you're not just blowing smoke?

title: BUTT OUT
text: Blow smoke? Us? No way! Because we don't need to smoke and neither do you, right kids? Butt out! Break it down!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Butt out! Yeah yeah! It's cool to say no!

title: BUTT OUT
role: Butt out! Uh huh! Smokin's got to go!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Smoking, no. No smoking.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Freestyle!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Vernon!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Don't smoke! Don't ever smoke!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Kyle!

title: BUTT OUT
text: B to the U to the T to the T to the O to the U to the T to the C to the I to the G to the A to the R to the E to the T to the T to the E! Butt out, cigarette!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Dude, this is unbearable.

title: BUTT OUT
text: I'm going to kill myself

title: BUTT OUT
text: Randy!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Smoke you know has got to go. You go, you got to know to say the "no" to the smoke, you go go..  ... you gotta get it!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Pam!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Don's smoke.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Woohoo!

title: BUTT OUT
text: You guys, Kenny's eating his own hands.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Hey! What's the big deal? I like smoking, and it makes me cool!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Ohoh, really?? Do you think lung cancer is cool, too??

title: BUTT OUT
text: What about emphysema?? Is that cool??

title: BUTT OUT
text: And what about abortion, and AIDS?

title: BUTT OUT
text: Pfft! That's none's the cool.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Word.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Yeah. So butt out!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Butt out! Yeah yeah! Give that cigarette butt a throw!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Huh, Jesus Christ!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Butt out! Uh huh! Smokin's got to go!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Remember, kids, if you smoke, you could grow up to be a failure.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Worse yet, you could grow up to be dead.

title: BUTT OUT
text: So don't believe what those evil tobacco companies tell you!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Yeah, because if you don't smoke, you can grow up to be-

title: BUTT OUT
text: Just Like Us.

title: BUTT OUT
text: South Park Elementary, loading area. The boys are there next to a trash bin, smoking ... and coughing

title: BUTT OUT
text: Give me a hit. Give me another one, give me another one.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Aw dude, this is really hard.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Oh shit, here comes Mr. Mackey.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Throw 'em away!  Dudes, here he comes. Guys, stop coughing.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Boys, what are you doing back here? I asked you a question: What are you doing back here, 'k?!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Nothing.

title: BUTT OUT
text: What??

title: BUTT OUT
text: Nothin' Na- Due-nothing.

title: BUTT OUT
text: D'awww sick!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Gross dude!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Well hey, if I didn't know any better, I'd think you boys have been smoking!

title: BUTT OUT
text: No... No, Mr. Mackey... We don't have any cigarettes.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Well you'd better not! Because let me tell you some'n' about smokin'!  Uh, smokin's bad, m'kay.  And uh, if you start smokin' at an early age, m'kay, ih it's gonna be bad.  M'kay, because uh, smoking can lead to all kinds of health problems like cancer.  M'kay, and let me tell you something about cancer, m'kay. Cancer's bad. M'kay, and uh, eh, what?  What the?  Holy shit! M'kay?!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Oh! Jethuth Chritht!

title: BUTT OUT
text: ...Woops.

title: BUTT OUT
text: The Principal's office ...er, the remains, anyway. Only the door and the desk remain. The bookshelves are burnt up except for the bottom shelf. The cabinets are charred. The desk is charred and two of its legs are burnt off

title: BUTT OUT
text: Well, you boys have certainly done it this time!

title: BUTT OUT
text: We're sorry.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Not as sorry as you're going to be when your parents get here! Ah, here they come now.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Oh God...

title: BUTT OUT
text: Come on in.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Stanley, what did you do this time?!

title: BUTT OUT
text: You'd better brace yourself, parents. The boys were caught... smoking!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Smoking?

title: BUTT OUT
text: No, it can't be! My son is not a filthy smoker!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Mom...  Dad, it was just a-

title: BUTT OUT
text: I don't have a son!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Eric, you've done a lot of horrible things in your life, but smoking? You're grounded for three weeks!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Three weeks?! Are you fucking kidding me?

title: BUTT OUT
text: Haven't you boys heard anything about how harmful smoking is to you and those around you?

title: BUTT OUT
text: Of course they haven't, because the tobacco companies have gotten to them first. This is really their fault

title: BUTT OUT
text: Yeah. This is really their fault.

title: BUTT OUT
text: No matter how much money the anti-smoking groups spend, the tobacco companies are there to fill our childrens' heads with lies and propaganda that make them wanna smoke.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Yeah, huh?  Ih, it's like the tobacco companies have control of my mind- No. Must. Fight it. Tobacco companies... making me want to smoke. Ah!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Oh my goodness, I had no idea.  Are you okay, sweetie?

title: BUTT OUT
text: Well, those God-damned tobacco companies aren't gonna have control over MY kid! I say we bring them down!

title: BUTT OUT
text: We need the help of the greatest anti-smoking celebrity that ever lived. Rob Reiner.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Who's Rob Reiner?

title: BUTT OUT
text: Rob Reiner's Smoke Stoppers, day. A blue skyscraper flanked by two taller blue towers, with the Hollywood sign in the background. Inside, Rob Reiner speaks to four executives, but he's facing the window. He's reading from some papers

title: BUTT OUT
text: I don't understand it. I pushed a law for higher taxes on cigarettes, I lobbied to get images of cigarettes removed from movies and art, I forced smokers out of bars and parks, but still I get letters from parents saying their kids are doin' it.  Apparently, people still don't understand hwo bad smoking people is for them. Don't they know how dangerous it is to their health?  Don't they know the hazard of second-hand smoke?

title: BUTT OUT
text: According to the letter, sir, the town has a tobacco company quite near them.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Yeah, that must be it.  The tobacco companies, with their millions of dollars and their slick desks and fancy buildings, they're the ones making music wanna smoke!  They're the ones hurting our nation's health! I will not stand by and see the children of America corrupted by those bastards!  This is war!!

title: BUTT OUT
text: South Park City Hall, day. People have gathered to greet Reiner when he arrives, and some people have signs saying the same thing as the banner. Other signs say "THANKS ROB!!", "Welcome MEATHEAD!" and "Give 'em hell REINER!" Stan and friends wait by the front door

title: BUTT OUT
text: You guys, maybe we should come clean right now and tell everyone that it wasn't the tobacco companies that made us want to smoke.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Hwat??

title: BUTT OUT
text: Why? It's perfect. If everyone's blaming the tobacco companies, then nobody's blaming us.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Yeah, what's the problem?

title: BUTT OUT
text: Well it's just that, eh, this seems like another one of those times when things are gonna get way out of hands, you know? It's been happening a lot lately. How about this time we just put a stop to it right now?

title: BUTT OUT
text: Dumbass, you don't wanna be grounded for three weeks, do you?

title: BUTT OUT
text: Yeah, don't worry dude. Things aren't gonna get out of hand.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Here he comes!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Damnit.  Butter!  Butter!

title: BUTT OUT
text: What'd he say?

title: BUTT OUT
text: Butter!!  Hello South Park!!  It is so nice to see an entire town come together to fight for good health! And I'm gonna help ya!  These poor innocent children have been seduced into smoking tobacco. So I say, "We fight fire with fire!" We're gonna use these children to bring the tobacco companies down!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Oh no...

title: BUTT OUT
text: The town bar. Reiner sits at a booth with the boys, feverishly eating. A waitress comes up with a platter of cheeseburgers and fries.

title: BUTT OUT
text: All right kids, here's what we're gonna do.  We're gonna sneak you into the tobacco company by saying you kids want a tour for a school paper.  Once you're nside, mm, mm, I'm gonna take photos and then we'll publish them, saying that the tobacco company invited you over to seduce you into smoking. Got it?

title: BUTT OUT
text: Got it!

title: BUTT OUT
text: But... isn't that, kind of, lying?

title: BUTT OUT
text: Mm.  Uh, we're just leveling out the playing field.  The tobacco companies lie to you about the dangers of smoking. If we're gonna take them down, we've gotta lie right back!  Oh my God!  Excuse me!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Yes?

title: BUTT OUT
text: Would you mind putting that death stick out?!

title: BUTT OUT
text: But, uh, this is a bar.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Isn't smoking illegal in bars here?

title: BUTT OUT
text: Not in Colorado

title: BUTT OUT
text: Oh my God! What kind of backward hick state is this?!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Look man, I work fourteen hours a day at the saw mill. I just got off work and I need to relax.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Well when I relax I just go to my vacation house in Hawaii!

title: BUTT OUT
text: I ain't got a vacation house in Hawaii!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Yuh your vacation house in Mexico, then, whatever it is! Look, you are putting my life and these boys' lives in danger by smoking that in here! And I'm not gonna tolerate it! I will end smoking in bars in Colorado! There will be no more smoking here!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Back at the table...

title: BUTT OUT
text: Isn't he awesome, you guys?

title: BUTT OUT
text: What??

title: BUTT OUT
text: Dude, he just goes around imposing his will on people. He's my idol.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Big Tobacco Co., day. Reiner and the boys approach the front door.

title: BUTT OUT
text: All right boys, just do what I tell ya and we'll be able to sue this tobacco company for two billion dollars!  As soon as we get into the mani facility, I'll snap the photo of you kids, and we can all run out! Think you can handle it?

title: BUTT OUT
text: Handle it? For two billion dollars I'd handle my grandpa's balls, sir.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Heh, great.  Okay, now watch yourselves, kids. These tobacco company people will do anything to get you hooked on smoking. They are liars and they are frauds!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Big Tobacco Co., headquarters. A door opens and closes.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Can I help you?

title: BUTT OUT
text: Yes. My name is Rita Poon. I called about my boys wanting a tour.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Ah, yes, Mrs. Poon. My name's Kevin Harris and I'm the vice president of Big Tobacco.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Oh. Hello, Mr. Harris.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Well, come on in.  How about a little history first?  Native Americans were the first to cultivate the tobacco plant. They smoked it in pipes for medicinal and ceremonial purposes.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Not if I were around, they wouldn't have.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Escuse me?

title: BUTT OUT
text: Oh, nothing! Please continue.

title: BUTT OUT
text: The first successful commercial crop of tobacco was cultivated in Virginia in 1612.  Within seven years it was one of the country's largest exports.

title: BUTT OUT
text: So, tobacco helped to build America.

title: BUTT OUT
text: That's right. Over the next few centuries the tobacco business was so great that many slaves were brought from Africa to help work the fields.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Which means, if it weren't for tobacco, many of our black friends wouldn't be here today.

title: BUTT OUT
text: And so for centuries, tobacco production flourished. Nobody was even aware of any dangers back then, until, in 1965, when Congress passed an act forcing all tobacco companies to put the Surgeon General's warning on their packages. So now, everyone knows the dangers of smoking. And some people still choose to do it, and we believe that's what being an American is all about.

title: BUTT OUT
text: That sound perfectly reasonable.

title: BUTT OUT
text: And here's our factory at work.

title: BUTT OUT
text: With a hidey lidey lidey and a hidey lidey lay

title: BUTT OUT
role: We work and we make cigarettes all hidey lidey day

title: BUTT OUT
role: So folks can get a breaky from their stressful lidey lives

title: BUTT OUT
role: And relaxy with the cigarettes we make all day and night

title: BUTT OUT
text: I like to have a cigarehette every now and then

title: BUTT OUT
role: It makes me fee-l calmer when the day is at an end. [hops onto
text: the wheelbarrow and rides away]

title: BUTT OUT
text: And if it gives me cancer when I'm eighty I don't care

title: BUTT OUT
role: Who the hell wants to be ninety anyway?

title: BUTT OUT
text: So with a hidey lidey lidey and a hidey lidey lay

title: BUTT OUT
role: We work and we make cigarettes all hidey lidey day

title: BUTT OUT
role: So folks can get a breaky from their stressful lidey lives

title: BUTT OUT
role: And relaxy with the cigarettes we make all day and night

title: BUTT OUT
text: Well, I guess that's the end of our tour.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Oh, here boys. Let me get your picture. Got it! Ha! You bastards are going down now!

title: BUTT OUT
text: What??

title: BUTT OUT
text: I'm not Rita Poon! I'm Rob Reiner! And you've just been Reinered! Come on boys, let's make our escape!  Don't you try and stop us!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Oh my God!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Temporary Smoke Stoppers offices, night. Reiner and the boys arrive

title: BUTT OUT
text: Hoh boy, that was great, kids.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Those people at the tobacco company all seem really nice.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Hah, you see that? They got into your head. Now you kids can meet some good, decent people, the folks who work to get smoking banned!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Temporary Smoke Stoppers offices, interior. The workers there walk around like zombies, or Igor, Dr. Frankenstein's helper. They make grunts as they pass each other. The woman runs off and the man chases after her.

title: BUTT OUT
text: This is how we get rid of smokers. We go state to state and do things like, use bogus studies and make extensive commercials to get the public on our side and force cigarette smokers to stop!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Wow. It's like, it's like, smoking brings a lot of people just a little bit of joy and, and you get to take that away from them.  You are so awesome.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Here you go Bob.  This is Mr. Baffrey. He does all our Photoshop work.  Now, all we have to do is Photoshop cigarettes into your hands!  And bingo! When this hits the papers the tobacco company is screwed! Hahahaha!

title: BUTT OUT
text: But dude, you're making stuff up.

title: BUTT OUT
text: You kids need to understand something, okay? Sometimes lying is okay. Like, when you know what's good for people more than they do.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Oh my God, that is what I've always said.  I love this guy!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Mr. Reiner, your bill to have smoking outlawed at bars here didn't pass.

title: BUTT OUT
text: What?!  God-damnit, what the hell is wrong with people in this state?!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Apparently, several people here still believe there's no proof second-hand smoke can kill you.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Well they want proof?! All right, we'll give them proof! Boys, I need one of you to act in a commercial for us! We'll shoot it tomorrow!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Wow, a commercial?

title: BUTT OUT
text: And you boys decide which one of you will be best for the part. All right people, we've gotta get moving on the bill to ban smoking in Potsdam! Let's go!

title: BUTT OUT
text: God, he's just the best!  Mr. Reiner, can I get you a muffin? O-or a cold drink, perhaps?

title: BUTT OUT
text: Outside the tent. Stan, Kyle, and Kenny rush out of there and stop some distance away from it

title: BUTT OUT
text: Guys, I thnk we shold bail out of this right now!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Huh?

title: BUTT OUT
text: This is just startin' to look like another one of those times where it, it's gonna end up with the whole town turning out, it's a big showdown happening, and us havin' to talk about what we learned, and I say we just stop right now, and go play cards or something.

title: BUTT OUT
text: (Well yep, that's what I think.)

title: BUTT OUT
text: Yeah, maybe you're right.

title: BUTT OUT
text: So, heh gentlemen, looks like only one of us gets to be in the commercial, huh? Who will it be...? Gentlemen, the game is on!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Go ahead. We don't wanna be in their stupid commercial.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Huh? Oh, I get it, Kyle. That's your Serbian Jew double bluff. Make me think you don't care about being in the commercial so that maybe I won't either. Ooops. didn't work, did it, Kyle?

title: BUTT OUT
text: No, we really want nothing more to do with these people.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Sure you don't, Kyle. Oh, and neither do I. Oh, I know what you're gonna say next. You're gonna say, "How about none of us show up tomorrow to do it?" And then I'm supposed to agree so that tomorrow you can waltz in all by yourself and do the commercial. That's Serbian Jew double bluff and it ain't  gonna  work on  me  ha  ha  ha . Only one of us can be in the commecial, gentlemen. The game... is on.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Kyle's house, night. Cartman climbs up to the second story and opens a window at the end of the hallway. He carries with him a bunch of lumber, a hammer, and some nails. He approaches Kyle's door and gets to work hammering the lumber in place over the door

title: BUTT OUT
text: Sorry Kyle, but I'm afraid only one of us will be showing up to do the comemrcial tomorrow! Hahahaha! Thought you had me with your Serbian Jew double bluff, didn't you?! Well let's see you try to open this door now.  Hahahahaha! Haa haa hahahahahaha! Haa haa haha-

title: BUTT OUT
text: What are you doing?

title: BUTT OUT
text: Oh... Hello, Kyle. Oh man.Wait, this isn't my house.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Cartman, you go ahead and do the commercial tomorrow. But I'm warning you, those anti-smoking people are liars and they're bullies who will stop at nothing to get what they want, and that means they're dangerous.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Hahahahahaha!  Nice try, Kyle! Let's see you try to get through the door now! Haa haa hahahahaha!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Temporary Smoke Stoppers offices, day. Cartman is at the photo shoot getting makeup, being prepped for the shot

title: BUTT OUT
text: Okay Eric, this is going to be real simple. All you gotta do is read the words on the TelePrompTer here.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Heh, ho-okay.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Let's see how the tobacco companies deal with this.  All right, roll camera. Roll the TelePrompTer. And whenever you're ready, Eric.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Heh, okay, okay.  You know, some people say there's no proof that second-hand smoke kills. The tobacco companies say there's no proof that second-hand smoke kills. I've just been diagnosed with terminal lung cancer. I guess... I'm the proof. The next time you want to believe that second-hand smoke doesn't kill, think about me. Because, by the time you see this commercial, I'll be... dead.  Dead??

title: BUTT OUT
text: And cut! Great! We got it! Wrap it up, people. That was fantastic.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Uh what... what does that mean, "I'll be dead"? Hey, uh what, what was that "dead" part?

title: BUTT OUT
text: That was very good, Eric. Here, eat this cupcake.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Uh, nnno, thanks. I'm not hungry.

title: BUTT OUT
text: But you are. Just eat this one cupcake. It has... sprinkles.

title: BUTT OUT
text: I'm not eating the cupcake.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Eric, do you know what a hero is? A hero is somebody who sacrifices himself for the good of others. Youc an be a hero, Eric. All you have to do... is eat the cupcake.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Jesus Christ! HAAAA!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Hey!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Stan's house. The other boys are in the dining room playing cards. Cartman opens the door, runs in, and closes it quick. He then goes to a window and looks to see if he's being followed

title: BUTT OUT
text: What are you doing, Cartman?

title: BUTT OUT
text: They're going to kill me!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Who's going to kill you?

title: BUTT OUT
text: The anti-smoking people! They had me say I died from second-hand smoke and... now they want to sacrifice me to make it look real! They'll stop at nothing!!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Well, get away from us then.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Yeah dude, don't get us killed too.

title: BUTT OUT
text: You guys have to help me!

title: BUTT OUT
text: No dude, get away!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Please, you guys, I don't know what to do!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Stop it, Cartman! Go die on your own!

title: BUTT OUT
text: If I go, you guys go!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Daaaad!

title: BUTT OUT
text: What?

title: BUTT OUT
text: Anti-smoking people are trying to kill Cartman and he won't stay away from us.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Don't be ridiculous, boys. The anti-smoking people are kind, caring, and intelligent. Your heads have just been corrupted by the lies of the big tobacco companies.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Hey, maybe that's it, you guys. Maybe the tobacco company can help us!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Help you, fatass! We weren't in the commercial, remember?

title: BUTT OUT
text: Yeah! Go to the tobacco company yourself!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Well that's fine. I thought you guys were my friends, but I guess I was wrong!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Yeah dude. You were totally wrong.

title: BUTT OUT
text: (Uh huh.)

title: BUTT OUT
text: You guys, I am seriously gettin' pissed off heah! Now come on, we're goin' to the tobacco company.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Oh all right.

title: BUTT OUT
text: No! What we really should do is go to our parents right now and take responsibility for smoking ourselves. Even if it means getting grounded.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Why?

title: BUTT OUT
text: Because, if we go to the tobacco company, I know exactly what'll happen. They'll take us in, and then Rob Reiner will show up with all the townspeople, holding torches or something, and there'll be a big showdown until we talk about what we learned, and change everyone's minds - this is all following a formula!

title: BUTT OUT
text: So it's either deal with all that, or be grounded for three weeks.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Big Tobacco Co., night. The town arrives with all the townspeople carrying torches and clamoring.

title: BUTT OUT
text: God-damnit!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Give us the child!

title: BUTT OUT
text: We will not!

title: BUTT OUT
text: There, you see that?! The tobacco company won't give us the kid! And do you know why?! Because they know that if they give us that kid, then we'll kill him! And when our commercial goes on the air, it will lose them business!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Yeah! Yeah, that's right!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Wait a minute, what?

title: BUTT OUT
text: Yeah. When we kill the kid, people are gonna think it's because of second-hand smoke! And then these bastards are all gonna make money, and they know it!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Wha- what the hell is wrong with you? That's not right.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Oh, God-damnit, do I have to explain this again?! Smoking is bad, people! So if we have to be a little extreme to stop it, it's okay!

title: BUTT OUT
text: No it isn't, you fat turd! Because, I've learned something today. You just hate-  See, I knew it.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Yup.

title: BUTT OUT
text: You just hate smoking, so you use all your money and power to force others to think like you. And that's called fascism, you tubby asshole!

title: BUTT OUT
text: GOD-DAMNIT THERE'LL BE NO MORE SMOKING!!

title: BUTT OUT
text: It wasn't the tobacco companies' fault that we smoked. It was our fault, us! We should all take personal responsibility instead of letting fat fascists like him tell us what to do!

title: BUTT OUT
text: You're right, boys, m'kay?

title: BUTT OUT
text: Yeah. Let smokers smoke.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Yeah!!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Hey Mr. Reiner, why don't you Butt Out!

title: BUTT OUT
text: I'm warning you: don't mess with anti-smoking groups!

title: BUTT OUT
text: I don't idolize you anymore, asshole!

title: BUTT OUT
text: My goo! My precious goo!

title: BUTT OUT
text: So Kyle, it wasn't the tobacco company that made you wanna smoke?

title: BUTT OUT
text: No.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Well then, you are grounded, mister!

title: BUTT OUT
text: You too, Eric.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Aw awww!

title: BUTT OUT
text: Added in later showings of the episode.

title: BUTT OUT
text: Well, I guess we learned our lesson.

title: BUTT OUT
text: No we didn't, dude! No we didn't!
